text: welcome to the first part of my
comparison between the original version
of Dark Souls 2 and its 2015 re-release
scholar of the first sin I've only
played scholar up until now but I've
heard people online debate about which
version is better and I was curious to
see how different vanilla actually was
as I play through vanilla I will also
replay each segment in scholar to see
what changes were made this series is a
way for me to share my findings from
this playthrough the aim of this series
is to present the facts and let you form
your own opinion on which which of the
two is better if I missed any notable
differences please tell me in the
comments on starting the game we can
already see a minor difference vanilla
has a prompt telling you about Autos
saves every time you launch the game
this prompt is absent in scholar
on starting a new game we can see that
the saving prompt in scholar says saving
save data while in vanilla it says
saving system data
the next difference is also minor the
publisher name in the intro cutscene is
Namco Bandai in vanilla and Bandai Namco
in
skolar right from the beginning
Scholar's lighting changes are evident
things betwix looks a bit brighter in
scholar than it is in vanilla in general
scholar makes bright areas more vibrant
and dark areas darker personally I
prefer Scholar's lighting overall but
some people's opinions May
differ the next change is seen a little
later one of the fog gates in things
betwix is blocked by a petrified Undead
in scholar this is because the area
passed that fog gate now contains an
Esther's flask Shard guarded by some
basilisks
The Forest of Fallen Giants is where we
start to see aot lot more
changes this area has more Hollows
attacking you at once in vanilla but
there is an ogre added in skolar it
isn't really a threat because it doesn't
attack you unless you get very close to
it rather it's a way for more
experienced players to get some Souls
fast in the early game vanilla has its
own equivalent of this which we will see
shortly there is also a corpse with a
life gem in vanilla that has been moved
to another part of the forest in scholar
keep watching to find out where it went
here in vanilla you fight three Hollows
one sleeping Hollow and optionally a
hide Knight while having arrows shot at
you this hid Knight is that vanilla ogre
equivalent I mentioned earlier
in skolar you instead fight 11 sleeping
Hollows while a soldier throws firebombs
at you vanilla has fewer enemies here
but you have to fight multiple at once
while in skolar you can fight the
enemies one at a time so one isn't
really harder than the other
she
in skolar a hollow is added on this
ladder but vanilla has two Hollows on
the stairs which are not present in
skolar
skolar adds multiple Hollows to this
section and adds boxes to hide the
soldier who has been moved
also remember that corpse with the life
gem from earlier in vanilla this is
where it went it's now on a corpse
hanging on a crack in a wall
the soldier near the Cardinal Tower
bonfire is asleep until you approach him
in vanilla while he is already awake in
scholar and will see you from further
away
those are all the changes covered in
this video thank you for watching if I
missed any changes or you have any
feedback about the video or any other
thoughts about the topic you'd like to
express please comment on the video with
your thoughts or what I missed see you
in part two
